faculties_accepted: NUS students can go to any faculty, but the Faculty of Law is not recommended.
visa_info: Exchange students studying for less than 6 months are not required to apply for a study permit but may have to apply for an eTA or visitor visa depending on their country of citizenship.
cost_of_living: No information provided in the PDF
university_description: The University of Calgary is a public research university located in Calgary, Alberta, Canada.
university_address: 2500 University Dr NW, Calgary, AB T2N 1N4, Canada
location_cost_of_living: Calgary is the most expensive city in Alberta and one of the most expensive in Canada with a higher cost of living compared to other Canadian cities due to its booming economy.
location_weather: The city has a humid continental climate with long cold winters and short but moderately warm summers.
location_description: Calgary is a cosmopolitan city that blends Western fun and country roots in a mix of old and new. The city is known for hosting the annually held Calgary Stampede, a rodeo that draws visitors from all over the world.
location_crime: Calgary is generally a safe city with a lower crime rate compared to other Canadian cities like Vancouver and Toronto.
location_transportation: Public transportation in the city includes buses and a light rail transit system known as the C-Train. The city has a bike-share program called Lime as well.
location_halal: There is a wide variety of halal food options available in Calgary.
location_vegetarian: Calgary has a variety of vegetarian food options available.
